I huff and I puff and I blow the nuclear radiation away. I then make a new hill and delicate it’s mine and if you come too close I will blow you away just like the radiation.

I build a small, altough still slightly bigger hill on a nearby planet, and proceed to hire a vogon constructor fleet to destroy your planet, thereby erasing your hill. 

My planet, my hill.

I take the X and chew it up. I then put an H in its place and run up the hill and nip you and stormpilot both. You both chase me and fall into a covered pit. I run back up the hill and plant my paws in place.

My paws hill

Your <abbr title="Part Action Window">paw</abbr> starts shilling.

Your <abbr title="Part Action Window">paw</abbr> shill.

I throw a giant mechanical bone which distracts you enough for me to release a swarm of robotic-laser-shooting-flying-space-sharks which chase you off the hill, I declare it is my hill, and anyone who wants to take it will get hit by a supernova while being only 10 au (astronomical units) away!

**Edited <time datetime="2021-08-11T18:20:07Z" title="08/11/2021 06:20  PM" data-short="2 yr">August 11, 2021</time> by Hyperspace Industries**

It was 11 au.  

The 11th escaped.

A free 11th AU.

I am immune to supernovas

I climb up the hill and vaporise all defence systems

now my hill

for protection, i build 9999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999 other fake hills (no point in taking those because they are fake)  randomly placed in other locations around the planet

I hire an overly enthusiastic immortal jeb kerman with infinite srbs to launch at other people trying to claim my hill

Disappointed that you foiled my plan, I decide to replace the sun with a red giant, engulfing and destroying your planet and all your hills (fake and real) along with the entire solar system, after which I build a dyson sphere around the star and use its energy to power magnets which shape the south pole into a hill of plasma,

my magnetically formed plasma hill

Over billions and billions of years, the red giant fades away into a white dwarf, then a black dwarf, and the energy from the dwarf is not enough to power the magnets shaping the south pole into a hill of plasma, causing the plasma to lose it's shape. Then, I, in my futuristic space mother ship scoop off a chunk of rock and ice from one of the surviving frigid outer asteroids at the edge of the solar system, unaffected by the red giant star, and build a new hill

My frigid oort cloud comet hill.

**MY** Dilaton hill.

I double snap. And make new hill.

Eventually, due to hawking radiation and stuff, the black hole decayed and collapses and i build a new planet with a new hill on it.

My hill

I build a matter-antimatter reactor nearby to provide cheap and environmentally friendly power to the hill, but purposely don't add a coolant system, which eventually causes it to overheat, and the hill along with everything else nearby is annihilated in a matter-antimatter explosion. Then I build another hill out of leftover antimatter scattered around from the former reactor. In order to prevent myself from being annihilated from coming into contact from pure antimatter, I magnetically isolate the hill from it's surroundings, allowing me to sit on the hill.

My magnetically contained antimatter hill.
